job_description_p:
['• multi-faceted\xa0
 • pioneer role in asia\xa0
 • transformational initiatives\xa0
 
 our client is a leading fmcg company with an illustrious heritage and innovative products. to support their growth initiatives in asia, they are looking for a high calibre compliance manager to join their team in singapore.
 
 reporting to the cfo, you will lead the development and refinement of their internal controls and compliance framework in asia pacific. this will include active review of current financial risk management and operational controls, and establish best practices to enhance operational efficiency. in addition, you will spearhead the deployment of data analytics to identify fraudulent transactions and formulate mitigation strategies.\xa0
 
 travelling in excess of 30% is anticipated.\xa0
 \xa0']
job_description_li: [None]
job_requirement_p:
['you are a qualified ca with at least 8 years of relevant experience, ideally gained with blue chip fmcg multinationals. prior exposure to data analytics and fraud investigations would be essential for success in this role. you thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and you are excited about being the pioneer in the function. a seasoned business partner, you have a demonstrated track record in establishing ia function/ processes and educating business stakeholders on risk mitigation.\xa0
 
 to apply, please submit your resume (in ms word format) to cynthia ang at ca@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number ca 14590. we regret that only successfully shortlisted applicants will be contacted.
 
 licence no: 16s8060; registration no: r1106954
 
 \xa0', 'type of work: permanent', 'region: singapore', 'licence no: 16s8060']

skills: ['auditing', 'accounting', 'financial reporting', 'financial analysis', 'management', 'internal controls', 'finance', 'internal audit', 'risk management', 'microsoft excel', 'microsoft office', 'analysis', 'budgets', 'financial accounting', 'leadership', 'process improvement', 'strategic planning', 'project management', 'business strategy', 'customer service']
job_description_p:
['key responsibilities', 'i.\xa0\xa0 \xa0planning the audit
 1.\xa0\xa0 \xa0assist the head of internal audit in developing and executing the annual audit plan.
 2.\xa0\xa0 \xa0assist the head of internal audit in risk assessment planning for processes and systems.
 3.\xa0\xa0 \xa0assist in developing the program of internal audits to determine the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls in addressing financial, operational and compliance risks.', 'ii.\xa0\xa0 \xa0conducting the audit
 4.\xa0\xa0 \xa0perform tests in accordance to audit programs and execute the fieldwork within assigned audit man days.
 5.\xa0\xa0 \xa0provide documentation in workpapers as evidence of audit work performed.
 6.\xa0\xa0 \xa0incorporate use of data analytics (e.g. excel) in audit assignments.
 7.\xa0\xa0 \xa0work with various stakeholders to identify and implement best practices and effective controls.', 'iii.\xa0\xa0 \xa0evaluating and reporting results
 8.\xa0\xa0 \xa0identify improvements in processes and develop cost-effective measures to mitigate overall risk\xa0
 9.\xa0\xa0 \xa0discuss findings with auditees constructively in order to jointly develop the most appropriate solutions to issues.
 10.\xa0\xa0 \xa0draft written audit reports to management stating the findings and recommendations in regard to systems, internal controls and other appropriate matters.
 11.\xa0\xa0 \xa0present audit findings to auditees during exit meeting.
 12.\xa0\xa0 \xa0review and appraise the adequacy of management’s agreed action plans in addressing the risks and recommendations identified.
 13.\xa0\xa0 \xa0perform follow-up audits ensuring management actions are completed within the agreed time scales and to escalate overdue higher risk items.
 14.\xa0\xa0 \xa0assist the head of internal in any reporting to senior management and audit committee.', 'others
 15.\xa0\xa0 \xa0assist in special projects, ad-hoc assignments and investigations as required.
 16.\xa0\xa0 \xa0keep abreast of developments in the auditing and pre-school educational industry to assist in update of audit methodology.
 17.\xa0\xa0 \xa0supports the association and company’s goals and philosophy. he or she shall actively involved in corporate projects, fund-raising efforts and community service etc.
 \xa0']
job_description_li: [None]
job_requirement_p: ['the executive, internal audit will support the head of internal audit to ensure that the internal audit function provides an independent assessment of the adequacy of the company’s internal systems and controls and compliance with regulations.']
job_requirement_li: [None]

job_description_p:
['ddb is the most-awarded effie agency in singapore, having ranked no.1 in effectiveness for five consecutive years.\xa0 we specialise in marketing and brand strategy, consumer planning, advertising, design, interactive, data analytics, direct marketing, promotion and research. ddb in singapore is part of ddb worldwide, the fourth largest communications network in the world, with 206 offices in 96 countries.\xa0
 
 scope
 
 the senior copywriter is responsible for generating the words, slogans and audio scripts that accompany advertising visuals.\xa0 this may include conceptualising ideas, creating slogans, catchphrases, messages and straplines for digital campaigns. it also involves writing text for print advertising, as well as scripts for radio jingles and tv commercials.
 
 key responsibilities:']

job_title: senior data scientist, app store analytics - business & marketing
job_description_p: ['at apple media products (amp) analytics, we analyze large-scale data across customer and content provider touch points in order to develop metrics and deep insights to measure performance and drive strategy.\xa0', 'our culture is about getting things done iteratively and rapidly, with open feedback and debate along the away; we believe analytics is a team sport.\n \xa0\n we encourage independent decision-making and taking smart risks. amp analytics collaborates deeply with stakeholders across product, design, engineering, and business teams: our mission is to drive innovation at apple through deep quantitive research of the app store, apple music, itunes video, ibooks, podcasts amongst other services.', '\xa0']
job_description_li: ['dive deep into large-scale data to uncover trends and identify key insights that will propel the app store business and marketing strategy.', 'shape how best to monitor, measure and understand business performance with a focus on asia.', 'collaborate with business, marketing, finance and executive teams to generate regular presentations for c-level.', 'partner with other apple organizations on data gathering, data governance, evangelizing kpis and democratizing data.']
job_requirement_p: [None]
job_requirement_li: ['minimum of a bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, economics or relevant field. ideally, masters in related field.', '4+ years of experience in a data scientist or data analyst role, preferably for an app or digital subscription business.', 'strong and curious business mindset with an ability to condense complex concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action.', 'well-versed sql languages. experience with big data technologies such as hadoop and spark preferred.', 'familiarity with python or r and data visualization tools such as tableau for full-stack data analysis, insight synthesis and presentation.', 'experience using relevant statistical packages to build predictive/ml models.', 'familiarity with a/b test experimentation design.', 'outstanding communication, interpersonal and presentation skills with meticulous attention to detail.', 'excellent time management skills with the ability to manage work to tight deadlines and handle the pressure of executive requests and product launches.']

job_requirement_li: ['phd/masters/bachelors in computer science, computer engineering, statistics, applied mathematics, or related disciplines.\xa0', 'excellent understanding of software engineering principles and design patterns.', 'excellent programming skills in either python, scala, or java.', 'in-depth understanding of data science and machine learning technologies and methodologies.', 'good working knowledge of high performance computing, parallel data processing, and big data stack, e.g. spark and hadoop/yarn.', 'experience to one or more commercial / open source data warehouses or data analytics systems, e.g. teradata, is a big plus.', 'experience to one or more nosql databases is a big plus.', 'hands-on experience in cloud platforms, e.g. aws, or containerization/ virtualization platforms, e.g. docker/kubernetes, is a big plus.', 'experience to any data science or machine learning platform, e.g. ibm data science experience or cloudera data science workbench, is a big plus.', 'exposure to mainframe system is a plus.', 'passion about machine learning and data-driven intelligence system.', 'excellent communication and presentation skills in english.', 'team player, self-starter, ability to work on multiple projects in parallel is necessary.', '2+ years of experience in machine learning system or data science research', '5+ years of experience in software engineering or devops automation or data engineering', 'experience working in multi-cultural environments']

job_description_p: [None]
job_description_li: ['design and implement key components for highly scalable, distributed data collection and analysis system built for handling petabytes of data in the cloud.\xa0', 'work with architects from other divisions contributing to this analytics system and mentor team members on best practices in backend infrastructure and distributed computing topics.\xa0', 'analyze source data and data flows, working with structured and unstructured data.', 'manipulate high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources to highlight patterns, anomalies, relationships and trends', 'analyze and visualize diverse sources of data, interpret results in the business context and report results clearly and concisely.', 'apply data mining, nlp, and machine learning (both supervised and unsupervised) to improve relevance and personalization algorithms.', 'work side-by-side with product managers, software engineers, and designers in designing experiments and minimum viable products.', 'build and optimize classifiers using machine learning techniques and enhance data collection procedures that is relevant for building analytic systems.', 'discover data sources, get access to them, import them, clean them up, and make them “model-ready”. you need to be willing and able to do your own etl.', 'create and refine features from the underlying data. you’ll enjoy developing just enough subject matter expertise to have an intuition about what features might make your model perform better, and then you’ll lather, rinse and repeat.', 'run regular a/b tests, gather data, perform statistical analysis, draw conclusions on the impact of your optimizations and communicate results to peers and leaders.']
job_requirement_p: [None]
job_requirement_li: ['experience in big data and machine learning', 'the ability to work with loosely defined requirements and exercise your analytical skills to clarify questions, share your approach and build/test elegant solutions in weekly sprint/release cycles.', 'development experience in java/scala and pride in producing clean, maintainable code', 'practical experience in clustering high dimensionality data using a variety of approaches', 'real world experience in solving business problems by deploying one or more machine learning techniques', 'experience creating pipelines to analyze data, extracted features and updated models in production.', 'independence and self-reliance while being a pro-active team player with excellent communication skills.', 'hands-on development with key technologies including scala, spark, and other relevant distributed computing languages, frameworks, and libraries.\xa0', 'experience with distributed databases, such as cassandra, and the key issues affecting their performance and reliability.\xa0', 'experience using high-throughput, distributed message queueing systems such as kafka.', 'familiarity with operational technologies, including docker (required), chef, puppet, zookeeper, terraform, and ansible (preferred).\xa0', 'an ability to periodically deploy systems to on-prem environments.\xa0', 'mastery of key development tools such as git, and familiarity with collaboration tools such as jira and confluence or similar tools.\xa0', 'experience with teradata sql, exadata sql, t-sql', 'strong experience in graph and stream processing', 'experience in migrating sql from traditional rdbms to spark and bigdata technologies', 'experience in building language parsers using antlr, query optimizers and automatic code generation', 'in-depth knowledge of database internals and spark sql catalyst engine']

job_description_p:
['about the institute for infocomm research (i²r)', 'the institute for infocomm research (i²r) is a member of the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) family and is singapore’s largest ict research institute. our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. for more information about i2r, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg', 'we are looking for strong candidates in the field of artificial intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on both fundamental algorithms in large-scale machine learning or deep learning, and also applying it to practical problems in vertical domains.\xa0', 'the position entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities at mit, stanford and cmu.', 'listed below are problems of interest in the deep leaming 2.0 project:', '\xa0multimodal deep learning: towards effective learning from heterogeneous data sources
 currently, deep learning is applied in various areas such as visual computing, speech recognition, text mining, etc. in each area, the learning model is trained with large amounts of data in isolation. a multimodal learning approach from heterogeneous data sources, including video, speech, text, etc. is necessary to achieve breakthrough in performance.', 'unsupervised deep learning: towards 10x fewer labeled samples
 labeling large amounts of training data is one of the most time-consuming steps in the deep learning pipeline, and is often not feasible. the aim is to achieve the same performance with !ox fewer labeled training samples. this is a strong step in the direction of unsupervised deep learning, where representations are learnt with large amounts ofunlabeled unstructured data.', 'deep learning on embedded devices: towards 100x smaller models
 current deep learning models have\xa010\xa0s of millions of neurons, making it infeasible for deployment on mobile and embedded hardware. the aim is to achieve models that are i00x smaller, with little loss in performance. this capability will also be critical for emerging neuromorphic platforms, where the number of spiking neurons is orders of magnitude smaller than in current state-of-the-art deep learning models.', 'online deep learning: towards near real time (nrt) model updates
 state-of-the-art deep learning models still take several days to train on expensive gpu infrastructure. a common problem is when new data (including new classes) are constantly added to an evolving, always\xad learning system. algorithms to move towards real-time updates will be essential.', 'extreme deep learning: training lb neural networks efficiently
 the high model capacity of deep networks is why increasing\xa0 amounts of data and model\xa0 size improves performance. however, there are substantial challenges in hardware and algorithms challenges in training very large models efficiently. the aim is to address these challenges to achieve more efficient training.', 'deep learning for spoken language processing and natural language understanding: towards better modeling of human communication
 language technology has made great advances through deep learning in the past five years, penetrating fields such as speech recognition and machine translation. however, there are still numerous challenges that need to be addressed, ranging from the requirement of specialized linguistic resources to large amounts of annotated data, and to insufficient theoretical grounding in deep learning. this aim attempts to address challenges that are often overlooked by major commercial ai players.', 'white-box deep learning: towards interpretable and contextually informed models
 current deep learning models are largely black-boxes that are not informed by contextual relations and provide little intuition. improved abilities to regulate the learning process, and interpret the resulting predictions will be essential for the next wave of ai applications -- especially for complex learning scenarios and appl ications involving critical decisions.', 'incorporating knowledge graphs into deep learning: towards better understanding of images
 current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of\xa0 bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. knowledge graphs like the mit conceptnet will be used to understand higher-level semantics and relationships between \xa0entities, \xa0to improve classification accuracy.', '\xa0']

job_description_p:
['about the institute for infocomm research (i²r)', 'the institute for infocomm research (i²r) is a member of the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) family and is singapore’s largest ict research institute. our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. for more information about i2r, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg', 'we are looking for strong candidates in the field of artificial intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on both fundamental algorithms in large-scale machine learning or deep learning, and also applying it to practical problems in vertical domains.\xa0', 'the position entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities at mit, stanford and cmu.', 'listed below are problems of interest in the deep leaming 2.0 project:', '\xa0multimodal deep learning: towards effective learning from heterogeneous data sources
 currently, deep learning is applied in various areas such as visual computing, speech recognition, text mining, etc. in each area, the learning model is trained with large amounts of data in isolation. a multimodal learning approach from heterogeneous data sources, including video, speech, text, etc. is necessary to achieve breakthrough in performance.', 'unsupervised deep learning: towards 10x fewer labeled samples
 labeling large amounts of training data is one of the most time-consuming steps in the deep learning pipeline, and is often not feasible. the aim is to achieve the same performance with !ox fewer labeled training samples. this is a strong step in the direction of unsupervised deep learning, where representations are learnt with large amounts ofunlabeled unstructured data.', 'deep learning on embedded devices: towards 100x smaller models
 current deep learning models have\xa010\xa0s of millions of neurons, making it infeasible for deployment on mobile and embedded hardware. the aim is to achieve models that are i00x smaller, with little loss in performance. this capability will also be critical for emerging neuromorphic platforms, where the number of spiking neurons is orders of magnitude smaller than in current state-of-the-art deep learning models.', 'online deep learning: towards near real time (nrt) model updates
 state-of-the-art deep learning models still take several days to train on expensive gpu infrastructure. a common problem is when new data (including new classes) are constantly added to an evolving, always\xad learning system. algorithms to move towards real-time updates will be essential.', 'extreme deep learning: training lb neural networks efficiently
 the high model capacity of deep networks is why increasing\xa0 amounts of data and model\xa0 size improves performance. however, there are substantial challenges in hardware and algorithms challenges in training very large models efficiently. the aim is to address these challenges to achieve more efficient training.', 'deep learning for spoken language processing and natural language understanding: towards better modeling of human communication
 language technology has made great advances through deep learning in the past five years, penetrating fields such as speech recognition and machine translation. however, there are still numerous challenges that need to be addressed, ranging from the requirement of specialized linguistic resources to large amounts of annotated data, and to insufficient theoretical grounding in deep learning. this aim attempts to address challenges that are often overlooked by major commercial ai players.', 'white-box deep learning: towards interpretable and contextually informed models
 current deep learning models are largely black-boxes that are not informed by contextual relations and provide little intuition. improved abilities to regulate the learning process, and interpret the resulting predictions will be essential for the next wave of ai applications -- especially for complex learning scenarios and appl ications involving critical decisions.', 'incorporating knowledge graphs into deep learning: towards better understanding of images
 current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of\xa0 bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. knowledge graphs like the mit conceptnet will be used to understand higher-level semantics and relationships between \xa0entities, \xa0to improve classification accuracy.', '\xa0']

job_description_p: ['reporting to the head of digital marketing, the ux/ui designer is expected to gather user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. to be successful in this role, you should have experience with design software and wireframe tools. if you also have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with web/mobile applications, we’d like to meet you.', '\xa0', 'ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base.', '\xa0', 'responsibilities:\xa0']
job_description_li: ['gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with digital solution lead and business stakeholders', 'illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows, wireframes, prototype and sitemaps', 'develop ui mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like', 'create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)', 'identify and troubleshoot ux problems (e.g. responsiveness)', 'conduct and assess usability tests and user researches through interviews, surveys, workshops, a/b testing and data analytics tools', 'conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback', 'adhere to style standards on fonts, colors and images; propose guidelines and styles updates to regional design team', 'partner with the regional design team on the management of digital branding elements', 'establish comprehensive reporting suite, to identify marketing performance, identify winning user experience and content to help improve and strengthen web and mobile presence and brand share of voice', 'stay informed with the latest developments of user experience and design methodologies, best practices, trends etc.']
job_requirement_p: ['requirements:']
job_requirement_li: ['proven work experience as a ui/ux designer or similar role; at least 4-5 years working experience', 'experience with user interface design patterns and standard user centered design methodologies', 'must be able to document and organize elements of the web/mobile applications into a coherent manner for technical development, work with minimal supervision; flexible to switch rapidly between different projects and manage them in a timely manner.', 'quantitative and user behavior analysis skills; working knowledge of web analytics tools such as google analytics or adobe analytics\xa0', 'fluency in sketch, abstract & it’s various plug-ins; (wireframe.cc , craft, invision and launchpad)', 'up-to-date knowledge of design software like adobe illustrator, photoshop and indesign skills', 'working knowledge of html, css, javascript, and bootstrap or equivalent frame work', 'ability to think strategically and creatively develop solutions around the current challenges faced by users on the platform', 'while being a creative thinker who can generate and appreciate innovative ideas and solutions, is also commercially-minded with strong business acumen.\xa0', 'have a passion for understanding customers, and experience in building a customer oriented culture.\xa0', 'superior verbal and written presentation skills to communicate clear, concise findings and actionable recommendations to both internally with functionally and geographically diverse teams and externally with creative and digital agencies.\xa0', 'excellent project management skills, good operational and process orientation.']

job_title: analyst , office of insights and analytics
job_description_p: ['you will be responsible for the design, development and implementation of analytical models, as well as interpretation and presentation of statistical outcomes to support the organisation’s operations and execution of key business strategies. you will design and conceptualise solutions that address the organisation’s challenges through the use of big data analytics and process large amounts of data by applying algorithms for optimisation, machine-learning and geo-spatial analysis. you will perform detailed data validation and accuracy checks and conduct both qualitative and quantitative analysis on organisational operations and performance. you will collaborate with stakeholders to build data analytics capabilities around clinical services, finance and operations, conduct feasibility studies, lead transformational projects as required, and facilitate regular meetings and reporting.', '\xa0']

job_requirement_p: ['·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 bachelor’s degree in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, operations research or related disciplines. master’s degree is an advantage.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 at least 4 years of hands-on analytical experience in data mining/modelling and quantitative analysis such as time series and predictive analysis', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 strong problem-solving and quantitative computational ability', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 experience with machine-learning techniques and algorithms for handling big data, in particular neural networks or deep learning.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 proficiency with software languages such as r, python, matlab/octave, c++ and with hadoop/spark or graph and analytics databases', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 strong written and communication skills', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 meticulous and a supportive team player']

job_title: team member in coo investment management asia pacific #120416
job_description_p: ['team member in coo investment management asia pacific #120416', 'credit suisse company overview', "as one of the world's leading financial services group, credit suisse provides its clients with investment banking, private banking and asset management services worldwide.\xa0 founded in 1856, credit suisse has a long tradition of meeting the complex financial needs of a wide range of clients, offering advisory services, comprehensive solutions and innovative products to companies, institutional clients and high-net-worth private clients globally. the credit suisse group is active in over 50 countries and employs approximately 46,000 people.\xa0 further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com.", 'further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com', 'we offer…\u2002\u2002\u2002\u2002\u2002', 'the opportunity to be a member of the regional coo team within the investment management department responsible to watch the discretionary mandates business and operations across all asia pacific locations, including:']
job_description_li: ['performance analytics: you will prepare and validate the investment performance figures of selected mandates, strategies and composites; you will monitor, analyze and report the performance to portfolio managers and senior management; you will maintain and evolve the performance reporting tools. your challenges will be the accuracy of the figures, the depth of the analysis and the timeliness of the reporting.', 'data analytics: as a savvy data cruncher you will handle daily data about investment strategies, portfolio, financial instruments and more, with the goal to answer partners’ requests, to investigate specific situations and to support the coo team in its product control and risk monitoring activities.', 'technical solutions: as proficient excel and bloomberg user you will maintain, optimize and further develop the reporting platform; you will support the portfolio managers and the senior management with ad-hoc solutions addressing changing business needs; you will support the coo team by building and maintaining solutions dedicated to risk monitoring and product control.', 'projects & platforms: you will contribute to or, depending on your skill level, assume a leadership role in projects aiming to improve and strengthen the investment management platform and processes. these projects are business, technology or regulatory driven, involving a numerous partners throughout the organization. this will give you the chance to develop your project management and leadership skills and to increase your visibility in the organization.']
job_requirement_p: ['you offer…', 'credit suisse is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.\xa0']
job_requirement_li: ['you possess a degree with a major in business administration, economics or finance (cfa, frm, cipm is an advantage).', 'you have at least 5 years work experience in either a performance measurement, investment management or business management function.', 'your proficiency in excel (macro is a requirement); bloomberg is also an advantage.', 'you have conceptual and analytical mindset with a positive ‘can-do’ attitude.', 'you have strong dedication to understand performance figures, to handle skillfully large data volumes, to deliver accurate results timely, to challenge and improve sustainably existing processes.', 'you have constructive and assertive personality, being a team-player who feels comfortable working across various departments, regions and divisions.']

job_description_p:
["the manager/senior manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. he/she establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. he/she manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. he/she integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.
 
 in addition the manager/senior manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. he/she drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.
 
 as a people manager, the manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. he displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation."]

job_description_p: ['job purpose:', 'we are seeking a manager of contracts and events (c&e) for the asia-pacific region .  this is a person who is passionate about\xa0delivering successful events, achieving the dual objectives of great participants’ experience and effective cost management. the events are primarily professional development (pd) events for ib educators across the asia-pacific region. an event will have multiple pd workshops running concurrently, the largest event having around 40 concurrent workshops. as the manager, you will partner very closely with the manager of pd. broadly, the manager of pd looks after the upstream activities of scheduling workshops and events, while you look after the downstream activities relating to events execution. the two managers must partner closely to deliver the growth of pd in the asia-pacific region, producing educators ready to deliver ib’s style of education and generates income to support ib’s operations and growth.\xa0', 'there are about 900 schools that offer ib’s programmes across the asia-pacific region. teachers of ib programmes must be upskilled via ib pd workshops. the pd department delivers approximately 1,400 workshops from a catalogue of 200 titles, educating 20,000 teachers annually. the workshops can be delivered as in-school workshops, which are produced individually and on-demand for a specific school. or as regional events, each a portfolio of multiple workshops that draws teachers from different schools across a region. the pd department delivers approximately 60 pd regional events annually. typically, the regional events are hosted by ib schools and to a lesser extent in commercial venues. to be effective, you need to possess strong partnering skills as the ib schools are also one of the most important stakeholders of ib.', 'your expertise will be instrumental in leading and shaping\xa0a team of three event associates and one event administrator. this position reports to the global head of professional development delivery. ', 'job duties:', 'manage the quality of events, partner with the quality assurance team to gather participants’ experience data, manage the process and team to elevate quality.', 'manage the contracting and payment of suppliers, ensuring that they adhere to ib’s policies and processes. put in place effective controls for risk and fraud management.', 'manage the events’ budgets, put in place effective processes to produce effective expenditure forecasts and ongoing expenditure monitoring and management.', 'manage the partnering process with ib schools or commercial venues to ensure timely commitment of schedule and capacity, in order to assist the pd manager in the production and ongoing update of the regional workshop calendar.', 'overall responsibility in managing the operating budget of the c&e department', 'manage the event associates to gather market intelligence to assist the pd manager to project and target pd demand.', 'partner with managers of pd delivery departments of the other regions to improve process alignment and achieve better effectiveness and efficiency.', 'partner with other departments for the appointment of workshop leaders, development and packaging of pd products.', 'partner with the data analytics team to develop analytic tools, reports and dashboards to support business growth.', 'partner with it to improve existing participant registrations and customer relationship management systems and process.', 'partner with the pd manager to explore new delivery models to grow the pd business']

', ' partner with it to improve existing participant registrations and customer relationship management systems and process. ', ' partner with the pd manager to explore new delivery models to grow the pd business ']

job_description_p: ['job purpose:', 'we are seeking a manager of professional development delivery for the asia-pacific region. this is a person who is passionate about\xa0the growth of ib education in the region and understands the importance of professional development (pd) in supporting this growth. pd produces educators ready to deliver ib’s style of education and generates income to support ib’s operations and growth. the person needs to think of pd as “a business with a noble mission” and has the fortitude to improve its system and governance to deliver strong growth.', 'there are about 900 schools that offer ib’s programmes across the asia-pacific region. teachers of ib programmes must be upskilled via ib pd workshops. the pd department delivers approximately 1,400 workshops from a catalogue of 200 titles, educating 20,000 teachers annually. the workshops can be delivered as in-school workshops, which are produced individually and on-demand for a specific school. or as regional events, each a portfolio of multiple workshops that draws teachers from different schools across a region. the pd department delivers approximately 60 pd regional events annually. ', 'you will work in close partnership with teams across ib to develop, schedule and\xa0promote pd products, in order to grow and capture market demand. overall, the pd manager is responsible for increasing the enrolment for pd workshops, improve the learning outcome and increasing our income from them.', 'your\xa0expertise will be instrumental in leading and shaping\xa0a team of three that will support the responsibilities of the manager of professional development delivery. this position reports to the global head of professional development delivery. ', 'job duties:', 'develop and deliver annual forecasts of pd volumes', 'develop and execute the strategy that meets the forecast and grows the pd business', 'maintain and improve pd workshops within the ib asia-pacific region, ensure the ib quality assurance framework is adhered to. review and respond to workshop quality assurance framework evaluations in order to maintain highest quality pd trainings', 'manage external providers and their workshops, serve as pd point of contact for all external providers’ workshop inquiries', 'manage the pd department and improve its systems and processes to support business growth', 'budget, forecast and reporting of workshop income', 'overall responsibility in achieving/surpassing budgeted income', 'overall responsibility in managing the operating budget of the pd department', 'project demand to schedule an annual calendar of regional workshops; placing the right titles at the right place and time. regularly updating the calendar to adapt to changes in demand', 'partner with the marketing department to grow and capture workshop demand.', 'partner with managers of pd delivery departments of the other regions to improve process alignment and achieve better effectiveness and efficiency.', 'partner with other departments for the appointment of workshop leaders, development and packaging of pd products.', 'partner with the data analytics team to develop analytic tools, reports and dashboards to support business growth.', 'partner with it to improve existing participant registrations and customer relationship management systems and process.', 'explore new delivery models to grow the pd business']

job_description_p: ['about redmart', "redmart is singapore's largest online grocery marketplace. we are a part of alibaba-backed lazada, southeast asia’s leading online shopping and selling platform. our online marketplace offers over 100,000 grocery and household essentials items with the convenience of home delivery 7 days a week. our mission is to save people time and money for the important things in life.", 'we are a fast growing, tech-powered company with an awesome culture (see our culture deck). we have great tech teams in singapore and bangalore. we work on a wide range of areas: consumer-facing mobile and web applications, search, recommendations, e-commerce, marketing automation, crm, marketplace seller platform, supply chain automation, warehouse fulfilment and automation, transportation logistics and last mile delivery. if you are interested in being part of the team that is transforming the grocery business, helping people save time and money daily, solving interesting challenges, and working with smart and passionate people, we want to hear from you.', 'role purpose', 'at redmart we use technology to delight our customers; we innovate to make our customers’ lives better.\xa0\xa0', 'as engineering manager - transport you will be responsible for leading a software team building transport intelligence systems at redmart. this team is responsible for optimising delivery efficiency while maintaining a high rate of on-time delivery and offering a variety of delivery options to our customers. the team will be based in singapore.\xa0', '\xa0', 'as an engineering manager you will:', '• lead a team of software engineers and data scientists that has full ownership of key parts of redmart’s last mile delivery platforms, such as routing and location intelligence.', '• conceptualize and implement transportation and telematics products, apps, algorithms and data analytics to provide a fast, reliable, convenient delivery experience at financially sustainable costs.\xa0', '• set the technical architecture for the team and take an active role in defining the product roadmap.\xa0', '• be responsible for driving impact by delivering on key initiatives as well as technical and business kpis. you’ll be expected to make a significant impact on these through great technical judgment, business process understanding, close relationships with other technical leaders and your business counterparts, focused execution and frequent delivery.', '• attract, develop and retain the best software engineers and data scientists. help them innovate, make an impact, continually improve at their job and grow in their careers.', '• champion engineering and operational excellence. lead your team to design, implement, test and run in production robust, highly available automated routing solutions that our 24/7 store and operations can rely on.\xa0\xa0', '• lead and contribute to cross-functional initiatives to improve engineering at redmart.', '• collaborate with other engineering leaders, product managers, and business counterparts to deliver company-wide initiatives.', '• foster a culture of continuous improvement through mentoring, feedback, and metrics.', '\xa0', 'what do we look for in a candidate?', '• customer focus. everything we do starts with our customers external and internal.', '• impact. we are results oriented. we value people who focus on the right things and get them done.', '• perseverance. building a great company that customers love is hard work. many challenges await and we are looking for team members we can count on when things get tough.', '• ownership. we are looking for team members who are not only owners of their work but regard themselves as owners of the company as well. they are flexible in what they do and constantly seek out ways to have a greater impact on customers and our company.\xa0', '• breadth and depth of technology experience and strong technical and product judgment.\xa0', '• track record of building and leading great development teams through hiring and coaching.\xa0', '• track record of successfully delivering multi-stakeholder projects that marry technology, people, and processes.\xa0', '• machine learning and domain knowledge. experience with building software for logistics, transportation or running machine learning and optimization systems in production is a must.', '• excellent verbal and written communication skills.']

job_requirement_p: ['we develop on a modern technology stack that focuses on enabling engineers to be productive and impactful. engineers work in teams to determine their own release schedules; teams develop, release and operate their software independently. we are strong believers in automation: we use automation for continuous integration, testing, and delivery. although we use amazon web services, we use open source software where possible. we continuously add to and update our technology stack.', '• microservices written in java or scala using play framework or akka, and occasionally python and nodejs.', '• angularjs for web apps.', '• native apps use objective c/swift (ios) and java/kotlin (android), fastlane, calabash, cocoapods/gradle, junit, and occasionally hybrid react native.', '• mongodb, cassandra, hazelcast for storage.', '• rabbitmq for messaging.', '• aws infrastructure, with haproxy, nginx, redis. chef deployments.', '• github, travis ci and trello, slack for development tools.', '• testing with junit, scalatest, frisbyjs, calabash and selenium.', '• kinesys, spark and aws redshift for our data infrastructure.\xa0']

job_description_p: ['company overview:', 'google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. true, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. at google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. we provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. for more information, visit www.google.com/careers.', 'the area: engineering & operations', "google is and always will be an engineering company. we hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. at google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. from google ads to chrome, android to youtube, social to local, google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.", 'the role: software engineer - singapore', "google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. we're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, ui design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. as a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. we need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.", 'responsibilities:', '- provide machine learning expertise to both existing and emerging new products.', '- innovate, develop, and deploy machine learning algorithms across google products.', '- collaborate with google machine learning experts across the globe to seek out new opportunities and advance state-of-the art in machine learning.\xa0', '- innovate new products, services, and applications, that might require deep data analytics.\xa0']

job_description_p: ["you'll join our regional finance team, based out of singapore and supporting both local and apac teams. one of the key strengths of the finance team is people from diverse backgrounds working together to deliver consistent results. this in turn enables finance to be a strong business partner to the regional/global operations run out of the singapore office.", 'the opportunity and the challenge', '• broad finance role covering a wide range of financial management and commercial aspects of the advertising business', '• exposure to the end to end process from cross border billing arrangements, managing/mitigating foreign exchange and tax risks through to receivable management.', '• opportunity to work across a network of agency finance and other ipg financial controller teams.', '• opportunity to gain an understanding of each local agency’s business model, operating structure and clientele etc.', '• opportunity to lead projects within agency that contribute to better processes and efficiency. key elements of the role client finance', '• lead the timely completion of quarterly cross border billing computation of fees for the region, out of pockets (client billable expenses), incentives and ad hoc production.', '• analyze any withholding tax and vat deductions that arise on cross border settlements - where appropriate building a case to recover the tax from clients', '• review monthly regional receivable reports and identify and support resolution of late/payment issues with client (regional and local asia pacific markets).', '• prepare working capital reports to analyze and manage ar/debtor and wip status across the region and report key issues from external (client) and internal (lowe and ipg treasury/shared services) stakeholder’s perspective.', '• review month end foreign exchange position to minimize fx losses.', '• analyse client profitability across the region, with special focus on unilever.', 'commercial finance', '• manage revenue accounting end to end, from cradle to grave for a few of the brands.', '• engage the business leads for client on structuring efficient commercial deals to minimize transaction costs in the form of fx losses and irrecoverable indirect costs such as vat/gst, withholding taxes etc.', '• manage working capital utilization efficiently and ensure positive cash flow at all times by requiring advance billing to customers.', '• manage wip accounts at a project level-track and ensure the business leads are appraised of any issues that need resolution.', '• review production and job related invoices and reconcile costs against pre-billing with tv & creative services departments within 3 months of last activity.', '• review the process of raising project cost estimates to customers to prevent agency from being out of pocket on incidental expenses such as local transportation, cell phone costs etc.', '• follow up with business leads on additional projects to maximize actual revenue vs. projections and maintain a tracker to support the budgeting and forecasting process.', 'others', '• support regional finance or agency specific assignments or special projects as required from time to time', '• assist in development of new reports / scorecards, as required, to optimise efficiency and accuracy of business reporting.', '• provide regional support on ipg internal and external audits.', 'key skills', '• excel – advanced skills typical of a senior level financial analyst to ensure dynamic reporting in a fast paced numbers environment. computation and data analytics/manipulation.', '• report writing & presentations – ability to distill financial information together with a rigorous understanding of which numbers are relevant and why; explaining the story that drives the variances.', '• finance systems – experience in extracting financial information in an enterprise-wide finance system environment such as hyperion, sap, longview etc. would be an advantage.', '\xa0']

 � transformation leadership role
 
 our client is a fast growing bank which has garnered strong industry accolades. there is now an exceptional opportunity for a dynamic service excellence leader to drive the bank's efforts in delivering best-in-class service to delight customers and achieve strong brand loyalty.", 'job responsibilities', "this is an exciting leadership role where you will be responsible for the bank's service excellence strategy and driving its transformation journey. managing a team, you will develop the service excellence strategy and roadmap, and drive the implementation of global best practices through robust frameworks, policies, processes, data analytics and service culture transformation. you will work with customer experience research on customer experience design (including processes, complaints management and customer journeys), as well as with branches, the contact centre, corporate communications and human resources on ensuring consistent delivery of the strategy.\xa0", '\xa0', 'requirements/qualifications', 'you are degree qualified with a demonstrated track record in service excellence leadership roles in consumer focused or b2c companies with strong reputation for delighting customers in the new economy. you are a strong user of data analytics in driving analysis, decisioning and performance management of customer experience. you are innovative, results driven and passionate about reimagining customer experience in the new economy. you possess strong leadership, presentation and influencing skills, and is a strategic yet hands on manager.']

skills: ['r&d', 'molecular biology', 'biotechnology', 'lifesciences', 'biochemistry', 'science', 'drug discovery', 'research', 'cell culture', 'algorithms', 'matlab', 'machine learning', 'pharmaceutical industry', 'cell biology', 'chemistry', 'protein chemistry', 'simulations', 'assay development', 'data analysis', 'drug development']
job_description_p:
['about the institute for infocomm research (i²r)', 'the institute for infocomm research (i²r) is a member of the agency for science, technology and research (a*star) family and is singapore’s largest ict research institute. our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. for more information about i2r, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg', 'we are looking for strong candidates in the field of artificial intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on both fundamental algorithms in large-scale machine learning or deep learning, and also applying it to practical problems in vertical domains.', 'the position, based within the program in artificial intelligence at i2r, entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities like mit, stanford and cmu.\xa0 listed below are problems of interest in the deep learning 2.0 project:', 'multimodal deep learning:\xa0towards effective learning from heterogeneous data sources
 currently, deep learning is applied in various areas such as visual computing, speech recognition, text mining, etc. in each area, the learning model is trained with large amounts of data in isolation. a multimodal learning approach from heterogeneous data sources, including video, speech, text, etc. is necessary to achieve breakthrough in performance.
 
 unsupervised deep learning:\xa0towards 10x fewer labeled samples
 labeling large amounts of training data is one of the most time-consuming steps in the deep learning pipeline, and is often not feasible.\xa0 the aim is to achieve the same performance with 10x fewer labeled training samples.\xa0 this is a strong step in the direction of unsupervised deep learning, where representations are learnt with large amounts of unlabeled unstructured data.', 'deep learning on embedded devices:\xa0towards 100x smaller models
 current deep learning models have 10s of millions of neurons, making it infeasible for deployment on mobile and embedded hardware.\xa0 the aim is to achieve models that are 100x smaller, with little loss in performance. this capability will also be critical for emerging neuromorphic platforms, where the number of spiking neurons is orders of magnitude smaller than in current state-of-the-art deep learning models.', 'online deep learning:\xa0towards near real time (nrt) model updates
 state-of-the-art deep learning models still take several days to train on expensive gpu infrastructure. a common problem is when new data (including new classes) are constantly added to an evolving, always-learning system.\xa0 algorithms to move towards real-time updates will be essential.', 'extreme deep learning:\xa0training 1b neural networks efficiently
 the high model capacity of deep networks is why increasing amounts of data and model size improves performance.\xa0 however, there are substantial challenges in hardware and algorithms challenges in training very large models efficiently. the aim is to address these challenges to achieve more efficient training.', 'deep learning for spoken language processing and natural language understanding: towards better modeling of human communication', 'language technology has made great advances through deep learning in the past five years, penetrating fields such as speech recognition and machine translation. however, there are still numerous challenges that need to be addressed, ranging from the requirement of specialized linguistic resources to large amounts of annotated data, and to insufficient theoretical grounding in deep learning. this aim attempts to address challenges that are often overlooked by major commercial ai players.', 'white-box deep learning:\xa0towards interpretable and contextually informed models
 current deep learning models are largely black-boxes that are not informed by contextual relations and provide little intuition. improved abilities to regulate the learning process, and interpret the resulting predictions will be essential for the next wave of ai applications -- especially for complex learning scenarios and applications involving critical decisions.', 'incorporating knowledge graphs into deep learning:\xa0towards better understanding of images
 current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. knowledge graphs like the mit conceptnet will be used to understand higher-level semantics and relationships between entities, to improve classification accuracy.']

job_description_p:
['company overview', 'intellect minds is a singapore-based company since 2008, specializing in talent acquisition, application development, and training. we serve big mncs and well-known clients in talent acquisition, application development, and training needs for singapore, malaysia, brunei, vietnam and thailand.', 'our client is an establish company a, leader within their industry, is now looking for a\xa0sas administrator\xa0to join their esteemed organization.', 'job descriptions:', 'duties and responsibilities:', '• provide day-to-day administrator support for maintaining a stable and scalable sas data analytics platform (dap) and products installed on the platform
 • lead efforts in defining and setting up work environments for various customer engagements that will be utilizing the sas application platform
 • lead efforts in developing policies and procedures for ensuring optimal operability of the dap environment
 • conduct reviews and define strategies for configuring and implementation sas application tools that best meet the customer requirements and environments
 • provide recommendations and assistance to researchers and analysts who are exploring and utilizing that latest sas data analytics capabilities
 • work with customers to understand and define project security, data, and operational requirements']
job_description_li: [None]
job_requirement_p:
['• five (5) years of hands-on experience as a sas administrator working with sas products on a windows platform
 • expertise and experience in managing sas application and operating system level security, managing sas configuration files, planning and scheduling sas processes, integrating with active directory authentication
 • experience managing multi-tier sas platform with products listed under sas data analytics platform (dap) that includes sas ebi, edm, em, forecaster, model manager and visual analytics
 • experience in setting up data access in sas, including registering libraries and tables in the metadata, updating table metadata, setting up data access, and troubleshooting data access
 • experience with different sas servers and troubleshooting potential configuration problems
 • demonstrate strong oral and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical topics to management and non-technical audiences, as well as interface with the customer on a daily basis', '• experience with teredata, oracle, ms sql database preferred
 • experience with ssl encryption of mid-tier information preferred
 • experience using a formal, software development lifecycle methodology
 • knowledge of ssa enterprise architecture
 • general knowledge of project management concepts
 • excellent communication skills and be effective technical writing skills
 • proactive self-starter', '_\xa0education requirements:_', '• bachelor’s degree in computer science, or related degree and 5 years of related work experience', 'all successful candidates can expect a very competitive remuneration package and a comprehensive range of benefits.', 'interested candidates please submit your detailed resume online.', 'to your success!', 'the recruitment team', 'intellect minds pte ltd (singapore)']

job_description_li: ['supporting subsidiary leadership as they execute compliance as a foundational & cultural pillar of their rhythm of business.', 'ensure strict adherence to policies, supported by leadership’s strong tone at the top and efficient compliance governance process with regular monitoring.\xa0', 'provide compliance support, consulting services, and monitoring in support of management’s business objectives and their responsibility to mitigate risk.\xa0\xa0', 'implement a structure of business & finance compliance champs in the sub; train them on driving good tone and investigating red flags and dashboard indicators.\xa0\xa0', 'facilitate the subsidiary compliance committee meetings to elevate compliance as top of mind with the country manager, senior leadership team, legal and hr, and orchestrate the remediation of compliance issues.\xa0\xa0', 'point of contact for all compliance questions in the subsidiary', 'detect and escalate any violation or deviation from standards and practices to appropriate microsoft management', 'work closely with the secondary deals review desk to ensure all high risk deals are subject to a pre-closure compliance review, all red flags appropriately resolved or escalated, and key learnings communicated back to finance and business stakeholders.\xa0', 'sca monitoring framework', 'plan and drive execution of the subsidiary compliance framework in partnership with outsourced testing agency', 'review the compliance dashboard to ensure its accuracy as well as follow-up and remediation of any non-green items, red flags, as well as sca and internal audit findings by the business through the compliance champs.', 'identify and address geo-specific risks not covered in the global compliance framework\xa0\xa0', 'work with outsourced testing agency (quarterly controls testing) poc to ensure prompt resolution of issues and feedback', 'review root causes and remediations for apac sca issues to ensure effective remediation taken by apac subsidiaries.', 'continuous feedback loop with controls testing, corp c&c and also support teams (e.g. buy center, accounts payable) to improve the risk elimination achieved by the 3rd party work.\xa0\xa0', 'conduct data analytics and produce actionable insights to focus the compliance efforts on the highest risk areas, leveraging compliance analytics program.', 'coordinate and manage internal audits from start to end and monitor implementation of remediation', 'assist in identifying topics, preparation of deck, follow up on action items for apac executive compliance committee', 'contribute as a team member in developing subject matter expertise (sme) for identified key risk areas']

job_description_p: ['about the opportunity', "from 3 members in december 2016 to a team of over 20 members currently, koku's exciting growth is expected to continue on this trajectory. we are targeting to grow beyond 30 members by the end of 2018 to support our overseas expansion plans. as we establish more operational bases in the apac region, we are looking for an experienced operations manager who is committed and driven to push us to an unprecedented level of operational excellence.", 'if you are a passionate individual who strives to learn continually, takes pride and ownership in your work, and you are confident of your knowledge and expertise in driving operational efficiency through strategic and tactical executions, we want you! be the main driver behind building the foundations of our new bases overseas.', "while you are based in singapore, the impact of your work will be spread across all of koku's regional bases, as you collaborate and coordinate with operational team leaders across all offices to strategize and execute plans. in short, you will play a key role in ensuring that koku punches above its weight and operates like a well-oiled machine that supports our growing team and the ever-expanding client base.", "things you'll do"]
job_description_li: ['working with management to set up operational processes, service levels and consistency across koku’s offices in apac', 'ensuring that koku’s processes are in line with local business requirements', 'coordinating closely with legal, compliance, business units for any legal documentations and agreements pertaining to regulatory, brokers and vendors', 'handling end-to-end operations such as trade processing, settlements, reconciliation including resolution of client queries and issues', 'maintaining relationships with various of our counterparties', 'identifying and measuring key operational risks and challenges, and propose risk mitigation methods to contain identified risks', 'performing daily and/ or monthly reporting and data analytics for nav accountings and valuations', 'executing go-to-market strategies for onboarding, go-live of new services or expansion of existing services into existing or new markets', 'guiding the functional line of service teams']
job_requirement_p: ["skills you'll need", 'technical', 'attitude']

job_description_p: ['senior change assurance specialist – apac #110095', 'credit suisse company overview', "credit suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking and asset management capabilities. founded in 1856, credit suisse has expanded to be a global force employing over 45,000 people in 50 countries. with new leadership, a new strategy and a streamlined global organization, we are set for growth. we partner across businesses, divisions and regions to create innovative solutions to meet the needs of our clients—and to help our employees grow. it is a high priority for us to continually invest in our employees by providing ongoing opportunities for training, networking and mobility. join us and let's shape the future of credit suisse together.\xa0\xa0", 'further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com ', 'we offer…\u2002\u2002\u2002\u2002\u2002', 'at credit suisse in asia pacific, we’re proud that internal audit is seen a key strategic partner to the business. our risk-based methodology is reflected in truly dynamic audit plans that ensure that the function stays completely relevant and that we have the ability to flex to meet the evolving strategy of this key growth business. our auditors have the opportunity to build and maintain direct and lasting relationships with the bank’s leadership and are actively sought out for the meaningful advice and insights. reflecting the bank’s entrepreneurial spirit, our internal audit function is also innovating; we’re investing in new technologies, data analytics, and the latest training techniques, to ensure that both people and platforms are best in class.', 'the credit suisse internal audit department has 350 staff based in various locations with the vision of being a compelling voice inspiring confidence in the ability of the bank to deliver its strategy. we play a pivotal role in safeguarding the bank’s control environment, seeking to deliver value-adding insights through audits and continuous risk monitoring activities to build confidence in the bank’s control framework and ability to achieve objectives. we are seeking talented, dedicated and high-energy professionals to join the audit team in asia and support management by providing assurance on the control environment supporting various credit suisse group activities.', 'the change specialist role, within the apac internal audit function, is passionate about providing assurance over the apac change portfolio and major change programs across the apac region. the role is key to ensuring that our audit work makes a valuable and timely impact, improving the strengths of our business, technology and sme audit professionals.', 'key responsibilities include:', 'in the first year you will be expected to have provided demonstrable value in the area of control for the bank’s main change assurance programs.', '\xa0']
job_description_li: ['building and maintaining positive relationships, in partnership with the heads of audit, with key partners engaged in delivering change across the apac region and related global functions and programs.', 'maintaining an overview of the apac change portfolio governance and risk profile.', 'maintaining an overview of key change programs in the apac region and sharing insights with relevant heads of audit and business partners to support continuous risk monitoring.', 'defining the audit coverage strategy for apac change, ensuring that there are appropriate plans in place for change assurance reviews and continuous risk monitoring over the bank’s top initiatives.', 'supporting the apac heads of audit and global head of audit, change assurance with quarterly risk assessments relating to change risk across the apac businesses, functions and sme areas.', 'executing change assurance reviews, demonstrating an ability to effectively prioritize completing dedications in order to ensure efficient delivery against agreed timeframes.', 'you will demonstrate effective risk awareness, and build an appropriate risk based, adequate and effective audit coverage to the audit assignments.', 'you are going to be providing support and challenge to colleagues engaged in change assurance reviews, both regionally and globally.', 'you are going to lead business and/or functional audits as an audit manager or provide auditor support, as required.', 'supervise audit teams, you will craft on the job training during job assignments, and provide necessary oversight and mentorship to ensure the change assurance review and/or audit is completed against relevant targets (e.g. budget, fieldwork timing, report clearance etc).', 'responsible for the detailed planning, scoping, managing and delivery of change assurance reviews and audits.', 'completion and documentation of assigned audit work within budgeted time constraints and in accordance with change assurance and audit methodology.', 'drafting of change assurance review and audit reports, and clearance of change assurance and audit issues with senior management.', 'you will provide assignment feedbacks of the audit team members on assignment.', 'in partnership with heads of audit, execute continuous risk monitoring on an ongoing basis to drive appropriate focus on identifying and responding to emerging risks, handling partner relationships with senior business management, and advise business management of audit insights and ongoing issues.', 'liaison with other team members, regional and global audit management during audit and continuous risk monitoring as required.', 'you will support the heads of audit on risk assessments.']

job_requirement_li: ["you possess a degree educated to either master's or bachelor's level.", 'you have a strong background of at least 5 years’ experience gained within a change assurance or program delivery environment, including relevant experience working with or within internal audit functions.', 'you should have experience of risk and control within the financial services industry or relevant portable skills and experience of complex program delivery in a highly regulated environment.', 'you have strong communication, organisational and interpersonal skills - excellent track record in client relationship management.', 'you have the ability to develop/improve teams, and work within a team environment.', 'you are self-motivated, dedicated and results orientated professional.']

job_title: customer reference marketing manager japac, google cloud - singapore
job_description_p: ['company overview:', 'google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. true, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. at google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. we provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. for more information, visit www.google.com/careers.', 'the area: marketing', "know the user. know the magic. connect the two. at its core, marketing at google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. our job is to demonstrate how google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. and we approach marketing in a way that only google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.", 'the role: customer reference marketing manager japac, google cloud - singapore', 'google is developing groundbreaking cloud solutions for companies, leveraging years of experience in building secure, reliable, and scalable cloud technology. with strong google differentiation in data analytics and machine learning, security, application development and collaboration software, we’re well on our way -- but we need more people who can help us write, tell, and sell that story. if you’re as excited about building what’s next as we are, google cloud is the place for you.', 'additional role description:', "as a customer reference marketing manager, you will be charged with communicating our product vision and roadmap to global industry analyst firms across japan and asia pacific. you'll work with leaders across google cloud, collaborating with teams in communications, product management, sales and field marketing.", 'responsibilities:', '- contribute to google cloud influencer relations strategies, and develop programs and opportunities for increased growth and impact of the customer advocacy program.', '- execute the day-to-day implementation of our customer reference program and act as the external contact for google cloud customers.', '- identify and onboard new reference customers, manage and monitor customer reference activity, keeping data current, accurate and up to date.', '- engage with marketing, sales, product and executive teams, on a daily basis, regarding customer advocacy. train internal teams on use of reference materials, processes, programs and strategy for customer assets.', '- ensure a positive customer experience through day-to-day activities, and work as an advocate for our customers.']
